Class OptionScreen

java.lang.Object
com.group6.hms.framework.screens.Screen
com.group6.hms.framework.screens.option.OptionScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
ScreenLifeCycle
Direct Known Subclasses:
CalendarScreen, DoctorConfigurationScreen, LogoutScreen, MainScreen, PaginationTableScreen, PatientConfigurationScreen, PharmacistConfigurationScreen
public abstract class OptionScreen extends Screen
Option screen extends Screen with selectable options. Example: 

     public class Menu extends OptionScreen {

         public Menu(){
              super("Menu");
              addOption(1, "Option 1");
              addOption(2, "Option 2");
         }

      @literal @Override
      protected void handleOption(int optionId) {
         switch(optionId) {
             case 1 -> {
                 //Option 1 is selected
             };
             case 2 -> {
                 //Option 2 is selected
             }
         }
      }
     }

  • Constructor Details

    • OptionScreen

      protected OptionScreen(String title)
      Constructor to initialize the OptionScreen with a header. This constructor passes the header to the parent Screen class.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the screen, which is displayed as a header.

  • Method Details

    • onDisplay

      public void onDisplay()
      Lifecycle method that is called when the screen is being displayed. This method displays the options and reads user input.
      Specified by:
      onDisplay in interface ScreenLifeCycle
      Overrides:
      onDisplay in class Screen

    • setAllowBack

      protected void setAllowBack(boolean allowBack)
      Set whether the user is allowed to go back to the previous screen.
      Parameters:
      allowBack - If true, the back option will be available; otherwise, it will not display the back option

    • addOption

      protected void addOption(int optionID, String optionDescription)
      Adds an option to the screen that the user can select.
      Parameters:
      optionID - The unique ID for the option.
      optionDescription - A description of what the option represents.

    • addOption

      protected void addOption(int optionID, String optionDescription, ConsoleColor consoleColor)
      Adds an option to the screen that the user can select.
      Parameters:
      optionID - The unique ID for the option.
      optionDescription - A description of what the option represents.
      consoleColor - Set the color of the option.

    • containsOption

      protected boolean containsOption(int optionID)
      Check if the given Option exist
      Parameters:
      optionID - - the option id of the Option
      Returns:
      true if the option exist, false otherwise

    • removeOption

      protected void removeOption(int optionID)
      Removes an option from the screen that the user can select.
      Parameters:
      optionID - The unique ID for the option to be removed.

    • handleOptionOnBack

      protected void handleOptionOnBack(int optionId)
      Handle the selected option. If the user selects '0' and back navigation is allowed, the screen navigates back. Otherwise, the selected option is passed to handleOption().

    • handleOption

      protected abstract void handleOption(int optionId)
      Abstract method that subclasses must implement to handle user-selected options.
      Parameters:
      optionId - The ID of the option selected by the user.
